primary_user_journey.context: Needs to manage time for routine activities like homework, cleanup, quiet time
primary_user_journey.motivation: Want to understand time passing and feel independent in managing activities
primary_user_journey.success_outcome: Complete timed activity with clear understanding of remaining time and positive completion experience

core_loop_steps.user_interaction: Child taps one of 4 large preset buttons (5min, 10min, 15min, 30min)
core_loop_steps.system_response: Button highlights with visual feedback, timer display shows selected duration
core_loop_steps.emotional_state: Confident - easy choice that child can make independently
core_loop_steps.success_criteria: Child successfully selects appropriate time without parent help

core_loop_steps.user_interaction: Child taps large 'START' button or selected duration auto-starts after 2 seconds
core_loop_steps.system_response: Immediate visual countdown begins with chosen animation theme, gentle startup sound
core_loop_steps.emotional_state: Engaged - excited to watch animation progress
core_loop_steps.success_criteria: Timer starts responsively with clear visual feedback

core_loop_steps.user_interaction: Child periodically glances at timer while doing activity
core_loop_steps.system_response: Continuous smooth animation showing time progression (circle filling, rocket moving, etc.)
core_loop_steps.emotional_state: Calm awareness - can see time without anxiety
core_loop_steps.success_criteria: Child can estimate remaining time from visual progress without reading numbers

core_loop_steps.user_interaction: Child notices animation nearing completion (90% progress)
core_loop_steps.system_response: Optional gentle warning animation (sparkles, gentle pulsing) in final minute
core_loop_steps.emotional_state: Anticipation - mentally preparing for activity end
core_loop_steps.success_criteria: Child begins wrapping up activity before timer completion

core_loop_steps.user_interaction: Child hears gentle completion sound and sees celebration animation
core_loop_steps.system_response: Positive completion message, confetti animation, gentle alert sound
core_loop_steps.emotional_state: Achievement - positive reinforcement for time management
core_loop_steps.success_criteria: Child receives clear positive completion feedback

core_loop_steps.user_interaction: Child either moves to next activity or starts new timer for same/different activity
core_loop_steps.system_response: Timer resets to selection screen, maintains session context
core_loop_steps.emotional_state: Ready for next activity - empowered by successful time management
core_loop_steps.success_criteria: Smooth transition to next activity or easy repeat timer setup

core_loop_definition.loop_frequency: 2-6 times per day during structured routine times (homework, cleanup, getting ready, etc.)

habit_formation.initial_engagement: Visual appeal and animation novelty create immediate interest
habit_formation.sustained_usage: Positive completion experiences and sense of time control build confidence
habit_formation.long_term_retention: Becomes natural part of routine, reduces family friction around time transitions

secondary_user_journey.context: Wants to reduce time management conflicts with child and build independence
secondary_user_journey.motivation: Seek tools that help child self-regulate without constant parent intervention

core_interactions.description: Parent downloads app, sets basic preferences, introduces child to timer concept
core_interactions.success_criteria: Child can operate timer independently after brief introduction

core_interactions.description: Parent identifies routine times where timer would help (homework, cleanup, etc.)
core_interactions.success_criteria: Timer becomes natural part of family routine without constant parent management

core_interactions.description: Parent assesses value of additional themes, sounds, or custom presets for family
core_interactions.success_criteria: Parent sees clear value in premium features for sustained engagement or specific family needs

intrinsic_motivators: Mastery - child develops better time awareness and self-regulation
Visual satisfaction - engaging animations provide rewarding experience
retention_drivers: Routine integration - becomes essential part of daily structure
Reduced family conflict - positive association with time management
Theme variety - premium themes maintain novelty and engagement
Success reinforcement - positive completion experiences build confidence
potential_friction_points: Initial learning curve for very young children (4-5 years)
Potential over-dependence on timer for activities
Animation novelty wearing off without premium theme variety
friction_mitigation: Large, obvious interface elements designed for youngest target users
Parent guidance materials for healthy timer usage
Premium theme rotation to maintain visual interest

key_relationships: One Session contains multiple Timer instances
Each Timer uses one Theme for visual display
Preset configurations create Timer instances with predefined settings
Premium Theme packs unlock additional Theme options
state_transitions: Timer: idle → running → paused → running → completed → idle
Theme: locked → available (premium purchase) → selected → active

child_engagement: Independent usage rate: >80% of sessions without parent help
Repeat usage: 3+ sessions per day during routine times
parent_satisfaction: Reduced 'how much longer' questions: measurable decrease
Improved routine compliance: parent-reported better transitions
Subscription conversion: 15%+ free to premium within 30 days
business_validation: Session frequency: 2.5+ sessions per active user per day
Premium feature usage: 60%+ of premium subscribers actively use multiple themes
Retention: 70%+ monthly retention for premium users
